definition: not giving performances, an unenlightened state
details:
adjective
- not giving performances
- having skin rich in melanin pigments
= synonyms: colored, coloured, dark-skinned, non-white
- brunet (used of hair or skin or eyes)
= example: brunet (used of hair or skin or eyes)
- devoid of or deficient in light or brightness
- causing dejection
= synonyms: grim, gloomy, blue, dingy, disconsolate, dismal, sorry, drab, drear, dreary
- (used of color) having a dark hue
= example: (used of color) having a dark hue
- marked by difficulty of style or expression
= example: marked by difficulty of style or expression
= synonyms: obscure
- lacking enlightenment or knowledge or culture
= synonyms: benighted
- stemming from evil characteristics or forces
= synonyms: black, sinister
- showing a brooding ill humor
= example: showing a brooding ill humor
= synonyms: sullen, glum, moody, sour, dour, glowering, morose, saturnine
- secret
= example: secret
noun
- an unenlightened state
= example: an unenlightened state
= synonyms: darkness
- an unilluminated area
= example: an unilluminated area
= synonyms: darkness, shadow
- absence of light or illumination
= synonyms: darkness
- absence of moral or spiritual values
= example: absence of moral or spiritual values
= synonyms: iniquity
- the time after sunset and before sunrise while it is dark outside
= synonyms: night, nighttime
